Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libblkid
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libblkid
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: util-linux bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The util-linux package contains a large variety of low-level system utilities that are necessary for a Linux system to function. Among others, Util-linux contains the fdisk configuration tool and the login program. This update fixes the following bugs: Because the "dmesg -w" command was not properly line-buffered, using "dmesg w" with a pipe character ("|") led to a significant delay in the response due to buffering. This update fixes line-buffering for dmesg -w, and the delays no longer occur. (BZ#1067354) The "lscpu --sysroot" command failed when it was used on a directory located on an XFS file system. This bug has been fixed and "lscpu --sysroot" now properly works on XFS file systems. (BZ#1072298) The "hwclock --systohc" command could enter an infinite loop on busy or virtual machines. Consequently, the machine could not complete the shutdown and reboot processes. A patch with a different mechanism has been applied, and the "hwclock --systohc" command now completes successfully. (BZ#1072930) The "wipefs" command incorrectly erased nested partition tables. On certain flash drives, this caused subsequent formatting to fail. The behavior of "wipefs" has been adjusted to ignore nested partition tables, and the command no longer makes flash drives impossible to format. Note that erasing nested partition tables with "wipefs" is still possible by using the "--force" option. (BZ#1077310) The "kill" command used by the ntfs service did not check the "errno" value after calling the strtol() function. As a consequence, using the "service netfs stop" command could kill every process on the system if there were more than 100 000 processes running at the same time. This bug has been fixed, and using the "service netfs stop" command only stops ntfs as expected. (BZ#1115442) The losetup utility was only able to use data offsets aligned to 512 bytes. This caused loop mounting to fail with a "Numerical result out of range" error when a different offset was specified. Now, losetup also accepts offsets that are not 512-byte aligned, and the described loop mounting failure no longer happens. (BZ#1127823) Previously, "wipefs" incorrectly attempted to use a 512-byte offset when erasing disks with 4096-byte sector size. As a consequence, the Anaconda installer became unresponsive when it invoked "wipefs" to erase such a disk. The erasing offset of "wipefs" has been corrected, and it no longer causes Anaconda to hang. (BZ#1127891) Due to incorrect logic in the upd_parts function, the "partx -u" command failed to update the specified partition if it was not the first partition. The upd_parts logic has been adjusted, and "partx -u" can now update all partitions. (BZ#1149278) The "raw" command in some cases did not properly handle the return value of the stat() function, which caused "raw" to fail with a "Cannot locate raw device" error. This problem has been fixed. (BZ#1181444) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: The swapon tool has been enhanced to have a more flexible set of choices when selecting the discard policy for mounted swap areas. (BZ#1077864) This update implements the "lslogins" command, which lists information about accounts on the system in an easy-to-read format. For more information, see the lslogins(1) manual page. (BZ#1113043) The "--fork" and "--mount-proc" options have been added to the "unshare" command. These options allow users to create new PID namespaces without using the clone() system call. For more information, see the unshare(1) manual page. (BZ#1131522) Users of util-linux are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes these bugs and adds these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
